-An item of clothing $75 or less
-An item of school instructional material $20 or less
-Clothing items must be less than $75 to qualify
-School supplies costing more than $20 are exempt

The Reading Board of Education met this evening and approved the 2020-2021 Reopening Plan by a vote of 4-1.

Parents will have the following options:
Option 1: Remote Learning
Students will participate in remote learning daily with online support from RCCSD staff.

Option 2: Blended Learning
Students attend a combination of in-person classes and remote learning. Students/Families will be given an option to request a morning or afternoon on-campus schedule with remote learning the remainder of the school day.

On Thursday, July 30, a letter and commitment form will be emailed to all parents/guardians. The form will give the option of remote or blended learning and the AM or PM session for each child. Forms are due back on August 9.

REMINDER: Reading School District's technology team has scheduled an additional Chromebook return day for Wednesday, July 15, from 9 a.m.- 12 noon and 2 p.m. - 6 p.m. Staff will be stationed outside the Reading Middle School entrance.

The district is asking for the return of all student Chromebooks district-wide. Our technology team needs to install updates and service all of the district’s Chromebooks to prepare them for the upcoming school year. Parents are asked to return both the devices and the chargers.

Parents can drop off Chromebooks for other students. Student names will be recorded by our technology team for each device returned. If you are dropping off a student device for another student, please make sure that the student’s name and grade level from the 2019 - 2020 school year is somewhere on the device with a post-it note or piece of paper closed inside.

If you have any questions, please email helpdesk@readingschools.org. Thank you!

We are excited to welcome Kindergarten students into the Blue Devil family! To attend Kindergarten in Reading, children must be 5 years old by September 30, 2020, and live in the Reading Community City School District.

Kindergarten registration looks different this year. Due to the state-closure because of COVID-19, our typical in-person registration procedures have been suspended until further notice.

To start the process, go to www.readingschools.org. You will find Kindergarten Registration under the Welcome Center tab.

☑️First, complete the online forms through FinalForms to begin the enrollment process for the 2020-2021 school year.

☑️After completing the online forms, please contact Kim Bell by sending an email to kbell@readingschools.org or leaving a voicemail message at (513)842-5100.

☑️Parents/guardians will need to provide several documents to Mrs. Bell. A list of acceptable documents is on our website at www.readingschools.org.
#BlueDevilPride

Open Enrollment Update...
Because of our school building being closed due to COVID-19, open enrollment registration will not be accepted in person for the 2020-2021 school year. Applications can be submitted online, dropped off at Reading High School, or mailed.

Application forms for NEW open enrollment students will be accepted for grades Kindergarten –12 starting on May 1 through 4 p.m. on June 1, 2020.

Applications can be completed online or submitted via hard copies. The application can be printed from our website or picked up at 810 E. Columbia Ave in the lobby area of the High School Entrance. These print copies will available starting on Monday, April 27 but will not be accepted until May 1. The lobby is open on school days from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Applications will be date and time stamped when they are received.

Please click on the link below for details on the open enrollment process and to access the application.
https://bit.ly/ReadingOpenEnroll

Time to recognize the accomplishments of our Blue Devils!

Congratulations to Reading High School Personal Finance Club senior team: Kristen Cain, Nate Grant, Meadow Kerlin, and Kylie Schmidt. They competed and excelled in the Ohio Personal Finance Challenge.

Nearly 500 students competed in the first round of the competition which was an online test. Reading finished in the top 3 and was set to compete in the final round, an in-person case study competition hosted by the University of Cincinnati. Unfortunately, it was cancelled due to the Coronavirus.

"I'm a bit heartbroken. This team is full of exceptional students and kids who I deeply believe in and respect. Deep down I felt they had a real shot to win a national championship," shared RHS teacher Brian Page.

Please join us in celebrating Kristen, Nate, Meadow, and Kylie who finished the competition ranked #3 in Ohio!
#BlueDevilPride

Gallery walk. Speed dating. Not your typical lesson plans.

Reading Middle School language arts teacher Amy Celis designs lessons to allow her students to become engaged and active learners.

Speed dating is a way of having discussions in smaller, rotating partners. There are a series of questions on the desk, and students rotate in an inner and outer circle, so they have a new partner to discuss each question regarding the book.

The gallery walk focused on figurative language. Examples of figurative language were posted around the room, and students worked in partners to identify the type of figurative language, and to explain what it means.

“We typically have great engagement in these lessons - students enjoy the chance to move, and to interact with different members of the class as we attack rigorous skills and material,” Mrs. Celis shared.
#BlueDevilPride #MyOhioClassroom

RHS Guidance Counselors, Mrs. Bemmes and Mrs. Eisenhard are holding an informational meeting on Wednesday, January 29, at 6:30 p.m. in the Reading Middle School Media Center. The purpose of this meeting is to go over scheduling procedures for current 8th graders as they prepare to enter their high school years.

Our RHS counselors will also meet with the 8th-grade students on January 27 during their English classes to go over scheduling procedures.

This meeting is designed for parents since the students will have already received the information in class. Students are not required to attend.

Reading Preschool Open House and Registration...
Reading's preschool is a 5-day a week, full and half-day program that follows the same school calendar as Reading Elementary. Due to the popularity of this program, a lottery will be held for preschool registration. All children must be 3 years of age on or before September 30, 2020, to enter the lottery. Four-year-olds will have priority in the lottery.

Preschool Open House
January 23, 2020 | 6:00-7:00 p.m.
Reading Elementary Room 35

Preschool Online Registration for 2020-2021
Opens Monday, February 3, 2020, at 8:00 a.m.
Closes Friday, February 7, 2020, at 3:00 p.m.

Notification of acceptance
Monday, February 10, 2020.

To learn more, go to www.readingschools.org. The online registration form will be open on our website on February 3, at 8 a.m.

S/O to our Reading wrestlers for an outstanding showing this past weekend at the Charlie Moore Invitational! Nine of our wrestlers placed and the Blue Devils finished second overall in the tournament which was held at Reading High School.

Reading senior wrestler Orlando Smith finished first in his weight class at the Charlie Moore. He is currently ranked #1 in the city in his weight class and advanced to a 17-5 record so far this season.

Orlando is in the running for the Enquirer's wrestler of the week and needs your vote! You can vote once per hour per device at the link below until Friday at 5 p.m.

Let's support Orlando and RHS Blue Devil Wrestling!

Thanks to all who voted for our Rubik's cube sculpture on Facebook! Our Reading High School sculpture class has won 2nd place in the 226-600 cube category.

Reading art teacher Laura Freese shared that Reading won a set of 12 Rubik's cubes to keep and use in future projects, an additional $30 to use in the Rubik Cube store, recognition on Facebook and Rubik Cube's monthly newsletter.

We appreciate everyone that voted--we couldn't have won without you! #BlueDevilPride
